description: From French déterger, from Latin dētergēre, from dē- + tergēre.

verbs.description: deterge (third-person singular simple present deterges, present participle deterging, simple past and past participle deterged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To clean (especially a wound) of undesirable material.
examples: Nature to attenuate, open, deterge, and dissolve; and Milk and Water, and Seeds, to cool, nourish, and balmify
